net.alexanderdev.lightdrive.state

Class StateManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.alexanderdev.lightdrive.state.StateManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Renderable, Controllable

    public class StateManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements Renderable, Controllable
    A class used by all Viewables to separate the logic of different States of the game from each other, while allowing them to be switched instantaneously, and to briefly communicate with each other.
    Since:
    March 6, 2015, 3:03:32 AM
    Author:
    Christian Bryce Alexander

        state - The State to add

      • addState

        public java.lang.String addState(State state)
        Maps the specified State to a guaranteed unique identifier.
        Parameters:
        state - The State to add
        Returns:
        The unique identifier that it was mapped to

      • setInitialState

        public void setInitialState(java.lang.String name)
        Sets the State that will appear first when the associated Viewable is opened. Cannot be set again once this StateManager has been initialized internally by the associated Viewable.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the State to set as current

      • init

        public final void init()

      • switchState

        public void switchState(java.lang.String name,
                        java.lang.Object... argv)
        Swaps the current State for another State as specified by name, and calls the new State's State.switchTo(Object...) method.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the State to switch to
        argv - A varargs list of Objects to pass to the next state
